children.name: Bantengan
children.description: Traditional costumed animal dance with possession ritual features from eastern Java, accompanied by percussive music using the large jidor drum.

children.name: Campursari
children.description: Javanese form of popular music originating as a mixture of local Gamelan with Western elements.

children.name: Javanese Gamelan
children.description: Broad classification grouping Gamelan genres native to Javanese culture.

children.name: Kuda kepang
children.description: Accompanies a traditional Javanese dance of the same name, featuring a stripped-back version of a Gamelan ensemble that removes softer instruments.

children.name: Langgam Jawa
children.description: Solonese development of Keroncong using a Javanese Gamelan scale known as pélog.
